WorkItem.ClosedComment: We're working with the Node Tools for VS to include better TypeScript support.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi,

the Node Tools for VS people have integrated NPM into their .nsproj Visual Studio projects. This provides the following functionality:

* An "npm" system folder for each project, similar to the "References" folder in the existing TypeScript projects.
* A right-click menu on this folder with options for installing, uninstalling or updating NPM packages.
* A user interface for searching and installing packages.

I've attached an image. More details to be found on [the NTVS site](https://nodejstools.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Screenshots).

At the moment TypeScript projects are based on the C# template and link up with the Nuget package manager. This is not as useful as NPM for JavaScript development.

Thanks.
WorkItem.Summary: Please provide an NPM UI for TypeScript projects in Visual Studio

Comments.Message:
That's great to hear. I just wanted a Class Library type project that also has NPM connectivity. I'll probably raise that with NTVS.

Thanks.
